::: {.callout appearance="minimal" collapse="true"}
## Who can apply?

Doctoral candidates in humanities, cognitive sciences, psychology, and related fields at the University of Luxembourg. Motivated Master students may request to participate if space allows.
:::

:::: {.callout appearance="minimal" collapse="true"}
## How do I register?

Complete the short interest form circulated by the Doctoral School. Seats are confirmed on a rolling basis, with priority given to students whose research statements align with the course themes and who commit to the project showcase.
:::

:::: {.callout appearance="minimal" collapse="true"}
## What equipment do I need?

We provide Micro:bit and Raspberry Pi kits and peripherals. Participants can also bring a laptop capable of running VS Code and Python (macOS, Linux, or Windows 11).
:::

:::: {.callout appearance="minimal" collapse="true"}
## How is the course assessed?

Assessment is pass/fail based on attendance and participation in a collaborative project. Optional challenge tasks contribute to an advanced competency badge.
:::

:::: {.callout appearance="minimal" collapse="true"}
### Can I integrate my own research project?

Absolutely. We encourage participants to align labs and the final showcase with their existing or planned research.
:::

:::: {.callout appearance="minimal" collapse="true"}
### What happens after the course?

Participants retain access to the hardware lending pool for additional weeks and are invited to present their projects at departmental seminars.
:::

:::: {.callout appearance="minimal" collapse="true"}
### Will there be support after the course?

Yes, we offer office hours to support continued learning and project development.
:::
